sen.j: 久坂 玄瑞（くさか げんずい、天保11年（1840年） - 元治元年7月19日 (旧暦)（1864年8月20日））は、日本の武士･長州藩士。
sen.e: Genzui KUSAKA (1840 - August 20, 1864) was a Japanese samurai and feudal retainer of the Choshu clan.
Genzui KUSAKA (1840 - August 20, 1864) was a Japanese samurai and feudal retainer of the Choshu clan.
Genzui KUSAKA (1840 - August 20, 1864) was a Japanese samurai and feudal retainer of the Choshu clan.

sen.j: 幼名は秀三郎、名は通武、通称は誠、義助。
sen.e: He had the childhood name of Hidesaburo, real name of Michitake and common names of Makoto and Yoshisuke.
He had a childhood name of Hidesaburo, a real name of Michitake, and common names of Makoto and Yoshisuke.
sen.cmt: the を a に変換、追加。コンマを追加。
sen.e: He had a childhood name of Hidesaburo, a real name of Michitake, and common names of Makoto and Yoshisuke.

sen.j: 妻は吉田松陰の妹、文。
sen.e: His wife was Fumi, younger sister of Shoin YOSHIDA.
His wife was Fumi, younger sister of Shoin YOSHIDA.
His wife was Fumi, younger sister of Shoin YOSHIDA.

sen.j: 長州藩における尊皇攘夷派の中心人物。
sen.e: He was a leading figure of Sonno Joi faction (those who advocated reverence for the Emperor and expulsion of foreigners) in the Choshu clan.
He was a leading figure in the Sonno Joi faction (those who advocated reverence for the Emperor and expulsion of foreigners) of the Choshu domain.
He was a leading figure in the Sonno Joi faction (those who advocated reverence for the Emperor and expulsion of foreigners) of the Choshu domain.

sen.j: 贈正四位。
sen.e: He was awarded the court rank of Shoshii (Senior Fourth Rank) after his death.
sen.cmt: 「贈」→死後に朝廷からおくられたものである意を表す（goo辞書）
sen.e: He was promoted to the court rank of Shoshi (Senior Fourth Rank) after his death.
sen.cmt: Shoshi は最後の”i"が要らないと思います。award より promote の方が適切ｄす。
sen.e: He was promoted to the court rank of Shoshi (Senior Fourth Rank) after his death.

sen.j: 長門国萩平安古（現・山口県萩市）に萩藩医・久坂良迪、富子の二男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Hiyako, Hagi, Nagato Province (now Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) as the second son of Ryoteki KUSAKA, doctor of the Choshu clan, and Tomiko.
sen.cmt: 「萩藩」→長州藩の別名。統一するため"the Choshu clan"と訳しました。
sen.e: He was born in Hiyako, Hagi, Nagato Province (now Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) as the second son of Choshu clan doctor Ryoteki KUSAKA and his wife Tomiko.
sen.cmt: 文が少々複雑なので改訳しました
sen.e: He was born in Hiyako, Hagi, Nagato Province (now Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) as the second son of Choshu clan doctor Ryoteki KUSAKA and his wife Tomiko.

sen.j: 藩校明倫館に入って医学および洋書を学んだのち、安政3年（1856年）、17歳で九州に遊学。
sen.e: He studied medicine and Western literature at the domain school, Meirinkan, and in 1856, traveled to Kyushu region to study there at the age of 17.
He studied medicine and Western literature at the domain school, Meirinkan, and in 1856, traveled to the Kyushu region to continue his studies at age 17.
sen.cmt: この方が自然だと思います。
sen.e: He studied medicine and Western literature at the domain school, Meirinkan, and in 1856, traveled to the Kyushu region to continue his studies at age 17.

sen.j: 宮部鼎蔵を訪ねた際、吉田松陰の名を耳にする。
sen.e: When he visited Teizo MIYABE, he heard about Shoin YOSHIDA.
When he visited Teizo MIYABE, he heard of Shoin YOSHIDA's reputation.
sen.cmt: heard of so and so's reputation の方が分かりやすいと思います。
sen.e: When he visited Teizo MIYABE, he heard of Shoin YOSHIDA's reputation.

sen.j: 帰藩後、松下村塾に学び、高杉晋作、吉田稔麿と共に村塾の三秀といわれた。
sen.e: After returning to the domain, he studied at Shoka Sonjuku private school and was referred to as one of the three best students at Sonjuku, together with Shinsaku TAKASUGI and Toshimaro YOSHIDA.
After returning to the domain, he studied at the Shoka Sonjuku private school, and was referred to as one of the top three students, along with Shinsaku TAKASUGI and Toshimaro YOSHIDA.
sen.cmt: comma と the をたしました。あと自然に仕上げるため改訳。
sen.e: After returning to the domain, he studied at the Shoka Sonjuku private school, and was referred to as one of the top three students, along with Shinsaku TAKASUGI and Toshimaro YOSHIDA.

sen.j: 松陰は久坂を長州第一の俊才であると認め、高杉晋作と争わせて才能を開花させるようつとめた。
sen.e: Shoin recognized that Kusaka was the most intelligent man in Choshu, and tried to develop his talent by letting him compete with Shinsaku TAKASUGI.
Shoin recognized KUSAKA's talent as number one in Choshu; he had KUSAKA compete with Shinsaku TAKASUGI in order to draw out his potential.
sen.cmt: 俊才とは必ずしもmost intelligent とは限りません。才能が有るという意味です。
sen.e: Shoin recognized KUSAKA's talent as number one in Choshu; he had KUSAKA compete with Shinsaku TAKASUGI in order to draw out his potential.

sen.j: 松陰は、久坂を自分の妹文と結婚させている。
sen.e: Shoin let Kusaka marry his younger sister Fumi.
Shoin permitted KUSAKA to marry his younger sister, Fumi.
sen.cmt: この方が自然だと思います。
sen.e: Shoin permitted KUSAKA to marry his younger sister, Fumi.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）、京都・江戸に遊学した。
sen.e: In 1858, he traveled to Kyoto and Edo to study there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1858, he traveled to Kyoto and Edo to study there.
In 1858, he traveled to Kyoto and Edo to study there.

sen.j: 安政の大獄によって松陰が刑死した後、尊攘運動の先頭に立つようになる。
sen.e: After Shoin was executed during the Ansei Purge, he came to lead the movement of Sonno Joi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After Shoin was executed during the Ansei Purge, he succeeded as the leader of the Sonno Joi movement.
sen.cmt: この方が自然だと思います。
sen.e: After Shoin was executed during the Ansei Purge, he succeeded as the leader of the Sonno Joi movement.

sen.j: 長井雅楽の「航海遠略策」によって藩論が公武合体論に傾いた。
sen.e: Uta NAGAI submitted an opinion brief called 'Kokai Enryaku Saku' (advocating trading with foreigners, rather than expelling them, by cooperation between the imperial court and shogunate), which led the clan to support reconciliation between the imperial court and shogunate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「航海遠略策」→http://www.pref.yamaguchi.lg.jp/cms/a19300/ishinshi/topics7.htmlなど参照し、説明を加えました。
sen.e: Uta NAGAI submitted an opinion brief called 'Kokai Enryaku Saku' (advocating trading with foreigners, rather than expelling them, by cooperation between the imperial court and shogunate), which led the clan to support reconciliation between the imperial court and shogunate.

Uta NAGAI submitted an opinion brief called 'Kokai Enryaku Saku' (advocating trading with foreigners, rather than expelling them, by cooperation between the imperial court and shogunate), which led the clan to support reconciliation between the imperial court and shogunate.

sen.j: すると、文久2年（1862年）同志と共に上京し、長井の弾劾書を藩に提出。
sen.e: He then went to Kyoto with his comrades in 1862 and submitted a petition for impeachment of Nagai to the clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He then traveled to Kyoto with his comrades in 1862, and submitted a petition for impeachment of NAGAI to the clan.
sen.cmt: commaを足しました。 苗字は大文字
sen.e: He then traveled to Kyoto with his comrades in 1862, and submitted a petition for impeachment of NAGAI to the clan.

sen.j: 藩論の転換に尽力した。
sen.e: He devoted himself in changing the opinion of the clan.
He devoted himself to altering the opinion of the clan.
He devoted himself to altering the opinion of the clan.

sen.j: 同年10月、幕府へ攘夷を督促するための勅使三条実美、姉小路公知らと共に江戸に入った。
sen.e: In October of the same year, he went to Edo with imperial envoys including Sanetomi SANJO and Kintomo ANEGAKOJI to urge the shogunate to expel foreigners, and formed Mitategumi squad with Takasugi and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In October of the same year, he went to Edo with imperial envoys including Sanetomi SANJO and Kintomo ANEGAKOJI, to urge the shogunate to expel foreigners. He then formed the Mitategumi squad with TAKASUGI and others.
sen.cmt: 苗字は大文字。長いので分割。
sen.e: In October of the same year, he went to Edo with imperial envoys including Sanetomi SANJO and Kintomo ANEGAKOJI, to urge the shogunate to expel foreigners.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 高杉らと御楯組を結成した。
sen.e: He then formed the Mitategumi squad with TAKASUGI and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 12月には品川御殿山に建設中の英国公使館焼き討ち事件を実行した。
sen.e: In December, they attacked and burned the British legation that was under construction in Gotenyama, Shinagawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In December, they attacked and burned the British legation that was under construction in Gotenyama, Shinagawa.
In December, they attacked and burned the British legation that was under construction in Gotenyama, Shinagawa.

sen.j: その後、水戸、信州を経て京都に入り、文久3年（1863年）1月27日に京都翠紅館にて各藩士と会合。
sen.e: He later went to Kyoto via Mito and Shinshu, and had a meeting there with other retainers at Suikokan mansion on January 27, 1863.
He later went to Kyoto via Mito and Shinshu, and met with the other retainers at the Suikokan mansion on January 27, 1863.
sen.cmt: thereは必要なし。theを追加しました。
sen.e: He later went to Kyoto via Mito and Shinshu, and met with the other retainers at the Suikokan mansion on January 27, 1863.

sen.j: 4月からは京都藩邸御用掛として攘夷祈願の行幸を画策した。
sen.e: In April he became a general affairs officer at the residence of the clan in Kyoto and planned an imperial visit to pray for the expulsion of foreigners.
In April, he became a general affairs officer at the clan headquarters in Kyoto and intrigued an imperial visit to pray for the expulsion of foreigners.
sen.cmt: residence of the clan を clan headquarters と改訳しました。
sen.e: In April, he became a general affairs officer at the clan headquarters in Kyoto and intrigued an imperial visit to pray for the expulsion of foreigners.

sen.j: 幕府が攘夷期限として5月10日 (旧暦)を上奏する。
sen.e: Around the time at which the shogunate informed the imperial court that the deadline for the expulsion of foreigners would be May 10, he returned to the domain and formed Komyoji-to Party in Shimonoseki.
The shogunate notified the May 10th deadline for expulsion of foreigners to the imperial court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The shogunate notified the May 10th deadline for expulsion of foreigners to the imperial court.

sen.j: それと前後して帰藩し、下関にて光明寺党を結成。
sen.e: Around this time, he returned to the domain and formed the Komyoji-to Party in Shimonoseki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Around this time, he returned to the domain and formed the Komyoji-to Party in Shimonoseki.

sen.j: 首領に中山忠光を迎えて外国艦船砲撃事件に加わった。
sen.e: He participated in the attack of foreign ships, with Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA as their leader.
He participated in the attack of foreign ships, with Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA as their leader.
He participated in the attack of foreign ships, with Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA as their leader.

sen.j: この頃、義助と改名する。
sen.e: Around that time, he changed his name to Yoshisuke.
Around that time, he changed his name to Yoshisuke.
Around that time, he changed his name to Yoshisuke.

sen.j: また再度入京し、尊攘激派と大和行幸の計画などを画策した。
sen.e: He also went to Kyoto again, and planned an imperial trip to Yamato Province with a radical Sonno Joi faction.
He went to Kyoto again, and planned an imperial trip to Yamato Province with a radical Sonno Joi faction.
sen.cmt: also は不要。直訳しなくてもよいと思われます。
sen.e: He went to Kyoto again, and planned an imperial trip to Yamato Province with a radical Sonno Joi faction.

sen.j: 同年の八月十八日の政変によって長州勢が朝廷より一掃された。
sen.e: In the same year, the Choshu clan was ousted from the imperial court in Coup of August 18, but he remained in Kyoto for a while as a clan government officer of Kyoto, trying to recover the power.

In the same year, the Choshu clan was exiled from the imperial court as a result of the Coup on Augut 18th. However, he remained in Kyoto for a while as a clan government officer, and planned recover his position.
sen.cmt: この方が自然です。長いので分割しました。
sen.e: In the same year, the Choshu clan was exiled from the imperial court as a result of the Coup on Augut 18th.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: その後、しばらくの間京都詰の政務座役として在京し、失地回復を図った。
sen.e: However, he remained in Kyoto for a while as a clan government officer, and planned recover his position.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: しかし、翌元治元年（1864年）6月、池田屋事件の悲報が国許に伝わると藩内で京都進発の論議が沸騰した。
sen.e: However, in June of the following year, 1864, the tragic news of the Ikedaya Incident came to the domain, where people furiously discussed about fighting in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, in June of the following year, 1864, the tragic news of the Ikedaya Incident spread throughout the domain, causing another debate on whether or not to fight in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: わかりやすいように改訳しました。
sen.e: However, in June of the following year, 1864, the tragic news of the Ikedaya Incident spread throughout the domain, causing another debate on whether or not to fight in Kyoto.

sen.j: そのため、来島又兵衛や真木和泉らと諸隊を率いて東上。
sen.e: Consequently, he headed for the east leading various corps, including Matabe KIJIMA and Izumi MAKI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Consequently, he headed for the east leading various corps, including Matabe KIJIMA and Izumi MAKI.
Consequently, he headed for the east leading various corps, including Matabe KIJIMA and Izumi MAKI.

sen.j: 真木和泉らと共に堺町御門で戦った（禁門の変または蛤御門の変）。
sen.e: He fought in front of Sakaimachi-gomon Gate with Izumi MAKI and others (the Kinmon Incident or Hamaguri-gomon Gate Incident), but got injured and killed himself in Takatsukasa House with Chuzaburo TERAJIMA.

He fought together with Izumi MAKI and others at the Sakaimachi-gomon Gate (so called the Kinmon Incident or Hamaguri-gomon Gate Incident). After receiving injuries, he took his own life with Chuzaburo TERAJIMA.
sen.cmt: この方が自然だと思います。
sen.e: He fought together with Izumi MAKI and others at the Sakaimachi-gomon Gate (so called the Kinmon Incident or Hamaguri-gomon Gate Incident).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 負傷して寺島忠三郎と共に鷹司邸内で自刃した。
sen.e: After receiving injuries, he took his own life with Chuzaburo TERAJIMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 享年25（寺島と刺し違えたとも言われる）。
sen.e: He died at the age of 25 (another story says that he committed suicide with Terajima by killing each other).
He died at the age of 25 (some believe that he committed suicide with Terajima by killing each other).
sen.cmt: storyではないので変更しました。
sen.e: He died at the age of 25 (some believe that he committed suicide with Terajima by killing each other).

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）発行の義烈回天百首には、彼の歌が収録されている。
sen.e: Giretsu Kaiten Hyakushu (collection of poems by samurai heroes) published in 1874 includes his poem.
Giretsu Kaiten Hyakushu (collection of poems by samurai heroes) published in 1874 includes his poem.
Giretsu Kaiten Hyakushu (collection of poems by samurai heroes) published in 1874 includes his poem.

sen.j: 時鳥 血爾奈く声盤有明能 月与り他爾知る人ぞ那起（ほととぎす ちになくこえは ありあけの つきよりほかに しるひとぞなき）
sen.e: A little cuckoo is crying in blood, and no one knows it except for the moon in the early morning.
A little cuckoo is crying in blood, and no one knows it except for the moon in the early morning.
A little cuckoo is crying in blood, and no one knows it except for the moon in the early morning.
